Administrative Assistant Job at Health and Development Support Programme

Health and Development Support Programme (HANDS) is a homegrown Non-Governmental Organization that is officially registered in Nigeria. It was founded in 1995 with the primary goal of supporting the National Onchocerciasis Control Programme in Nigeria as CBM Onchocerciasis Control programme. Over time, HANDS has broadened its scope to encompass various initiatives aimed at improving public health, fostering development, and providing emergency services. HANDS envisions a quality life with equal opportunities in an inclusive society. The organization collaborates with communities, government agencies, and developmental organizations to achieve its objectives. The organization is active in the FCT and multiple states across Nigeria, focusing on controlling and elimination of Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs), preventing blindness, promoting disability inclusion, offering clubfoot treatment, and providing reproductive health, gender mainstreaming and emergency response services. HANDS' headquarters is situated in Jos, Plateau State, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Locations: Jigawa & Kano
Employment Type: Temporary

Key Responsibilities


	Assist with logistical arrangements for trainings, meetings, and field visits.
	Maintain accurate records and documentation of programme activities and expenditures.
	Undertake all supportive routine administrative duties as applicable to the office
	Undertake supportive secretarial duties as applicable to the office (Typing, scanning etc)
	Maintain good management and distribution of stationery and welfare items.
	Keep and update stationery records and monitor stock situation.
	Assist in organizing logistics during meetings and training.
	Assist in keeping stock of stationery and reprint for restock.
	Assist in filing of documents as may be directed and keep records of confidential information.
	To raise request for purchases within the petty cash limit.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Public Administration, Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1 year of experience in education, disability inclusion, or community development, preferably in Northern Nigeria.
	Experience working with children and youth with disabilities or marginalized groups is highly desirable.
	Knowledge of inclusive education and livelihoods programming, especially in low resource or conflict affected settings.
	Strong communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic data collection tools.
	Fluency in English and at least one local language spoken in North Western Nigeria.
	Ability and willingness to travel to project sites within the region.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@handsnigeria.org using “Adhoc Administrative Assistant - Inclusive Education (North West Nigeria)” as the subject of the

Head of Human Resources and Administration Job at Zuma Health Trust Limited




        
    

        
        Zuma Health Trust Limited, a leading HMO in Abuja, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Human Resources and Administration

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary

	We are seeking a well experienced Head of Human Resources and Administration who will be a member of the Senior Management Team, and will be responsible for developing, defining and coordinating all human resource functions within the organization.
	You will be responsible for developing policies and procedures pertinent to organizational culture and processes as well as supporting all members of staff in order to ensure they reach their potential within the group.


Requirements
Applications are welcome from individuals who meet the following criteria: 


	Minimum of First degree or its equivalent in administration or related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience post-NYSC.
	Minimum of 5 years experience in relevant and related field Attendance of related Courses/ workshops/seminars etc
	Post Graduate Qualification in Administration, health or related fields
	Certification in or professional membership of administration, personnel or related bodies
	Good knowledge of Ms Excel, Ms Word.


Skills Required:


	Strong decision making and leadership skills
	Strong analytical skills 
	Good communication and interpersonal skills 
	Ability to work under pressure and meet targets 
	Able to plan and prioritize 
	Ability to work independently.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Interested and qualified candidates should send their application, accompanied by a detailed Curriculum Vitae and copies of relevant qualification (s) via email only to: vacancyjob278@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	The submission should be in a single attachment.
	Applications must be received within two (2) weeks from the date of advertisement.
	Please note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted for the next stage(s) of the exercise.

  "description": "Sayed Farms Limited is specialized in poultry sector covering all its major aspects, and also in the distribution of frozen food in the Nigerian Market. Our line of frozen products has expanded to include the finest quality of chicken, potatoes, cheese, vegetables, seafood, and ice cream products in the market.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Reference: ACCT2025025
Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintain and reconcile the general ledger and sub-ledgers (e.g., receivables, payables, fixed assets, payroll).
	Record daily financial transactions in compliance with applicable accounting standards (IFRS).
	Perform monthly and year-end closing processes.
	Maintain the chart of accounts and ensure proper classification of financial entries.
